history.text:
Hello! how are you? Have you heard of the movie The Wolf of Wall S
treet?
Hello!  Yes, I've heard of the movie The Wolf of Wall Street.
I'm not sure what it is about.
Great! It has some great cast members. Like Leo Dicaprio, Jonah Hill, Margot Robbies, and well Martin Scorses at the helm of direction!
That is a great list of cast members!

The overall reviews by critics aren't that great though. Above the average 
but I think the movie deserves better scores in my opinion.
One critic says "Epic in size, claustrophobically narrow in scope."
Not sure the movie deserves this criticism
The critics don't always agree with the viewers!  What sort of movie is this?  A comedy?
It is a black comedy based on Jordan Belfort (DiCaprio)'s life as a stockboroker in New York City
That sounds interesting.  So this character is based on a real person?

Yes. Jordan Belfort did exist and his firm "Stratton Oakmont" he worked at
 was a real firm as well (from the documents given alone)
Cool.  Is this movie appropriate for teens?
So Jordan Belfort starts a brokerage job at a legitimage Wall Street firm but soon gets fired. According to the document it says something about "sex and drugs fueled"
actually not fired.. more like his career ended
Whoa.  So, probably not appropriate for "family movie night"!  Ok.
It sounds like the movie follows him along on this journey.  How long is the movie?
I guess so. And you know what's interesting about Jordan Belfort. He is a survivor! He starts a new career after the market crash
That's great for him.  So he rose up from his adversity.
Did he stay a stockbroker?
The document doesn't say how long the movie is but I guess it should be long.
Yes. He meets Donnie Azoff and starts a new company together, Stratton Oakmont.
Earlier you said that the critics said that it was "Epic in size".  How is the cinematography?
Does it all take place in an office building?
I'd say you won't be disappointed!
Well I guess some parts of the movie take place at his workplace but the movie also shows a lot about his private life
And his wife leaving him was a severe blow to his career and life
It sounds like it could be emotional at times.  I guess having a wide range of emotions as a viewer is part of a good movie experience.
Do you know what year this movie came out?
Well yes. And Jordan Belfort even gets backstabbed by his friend Donnie Azoff
That must be more hurtful than anything else
So, even though this guy sort of self-destructs, it sounds like the viewer can really empathize and sympathize with him.
yes I agree.
Thank you for chatting with me today :)
Good bye

uid1response.feedback: The other user seemed to really enjoy the movie and answered most of my questions.  The other user really only discussed the main character in detail, so some of my other questions were not fully explored.  I would watch it because the other viewer gave me their opinion and backed it up with reason.

uid2response.feedback: I had good conversation with my conversation partner.
